confession.seduction_context: She and husband were depressed because they could not pay debt for a pair of oxen they had bought. Went out to woods, where she met Parsin
sabbat_activities: carried up in air by great wind

testimony.quarrel_subject: angry because she was not called when his wife gave birth

witnesses.name: Catherine veuve Mre Claude Barbe chirurgien

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband of witness rang Ave Maria at hôpital where they lived
persuaded her daughter not to marry a young man called Henry

testimony.threat_quote: que seroit bien autre chose dimenche prochain

testimony.quarrel_subject: found child face down in cradle, quarrelled with her
claimed she had been badly paid
testimony.threat_quote: she would never raise any children

testimony.quarrel_subject: disputes between Agnes femme Mre Didier Vaulthier and accused

testimony.threat_quote: she would help her in future according to how she paid

witnesses.name: Jehenne veuve honnble homme Claude Brabant

harms_alleged.target: her daughter's baby (Fleurance femme Anthoine Sachot)
her late sister Barbon (wife of Humbert Bastien)

testimony.quarrel_subject: brother had not nailed up a chest as she had asked

testimony.threat_quote: either mother or child would die

witnesses.name: Mongeatte femme honnble homme Nicolas Bernard

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied being a witch

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Voluntary confession - admitted to witchcraft to avoid torture, confessed to killing only own animals

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions, added killing one of their own horses

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders that she be tortured

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - retracted confession initially, then confessed to killing 25 children, 8 women, and 1 man, plus attending sabbat

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions under torture, added details about sexual relations with devil and desecrating host

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Jean Petit
timeline.details: Change de Nancy recommends that she be burned alive

accomplices_named.name: wife of Claudon St Remy
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat, plotted with her to kill wife of Nicolas Bernard

accomplices_named.name: Barbe, midwife of the Grand Faulbourg
wife of Jean Faillé
accomplices_named.context: Plotted with her to kill wife of Nicolas Bernard

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Jean Petit
notable_quotes.french: que seroit bien autre chose dimenche prochain
notable_quotes.context: Ominous prediction about Bernard Huel's wife, who died 2-3 days later on Sunday

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Jean Petit
notable_quotes.french: qu'ils avoient beau faire d'aller en pelerinage, que les saincts ne luy vouloient rien faire
notable_quotes.english: that they could go on pilgrimage as much as they liked, but the saints would do nothing for him
notable_quotes.context: Said about Demenge des Mailles' paralyzed arm

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness 5 (Sebille femme Didier Lassus)
notable_quotes.french: une femme fort difficile a entretenir
notable_quotes.english: a very difficult woman to deal with

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness 16 (Jehenne veuve Claude Brabant)
notable_quotes.french: et qu'elle est fort difficile de la traicter comme chacun scait
notable_quotes.english: and she is very difficult to treat, as everyone knows
notable_quotes.context: Community assessment of Jennon's difficult personality

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Jean Petit (confession)
notable_quotes.french: en desdain qu'on ne luy donnoit a boire, et qu'elle n'avoit le credit comme en une maison bourgeoise telle que celle la, dequoy estant faschée du peu d'entretement qu'on faisoit d'elle
notable_quotes.english: in disdain that they did not give her anything to drink, and that she did not have the credit/status as in a bourgeois house like that, being angry at the little respect they showed her
notable_quotes.context: Her motive for killing Anne Moiron femme Bernard Huel

harms_catalog.harm_description: newborn died within an hour after being baptized at home
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with witness's mother; refused to acknowledge witness was pregnant

harms_catalog.victim_name: son of Adam Vaulthien
harms_catalog.harm_description: infant fell ill and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: angry because she was not called when his wife gave birth

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Catherine (wife of Lucas Toussainct)
harms_catalog.harm_description: unable to deliver for a week, then died in childbed

harms_catalog.victim_name: 3 children of Sebille femme Didier Lassus
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of 3 children; witness also lost her milk

harms_catalog.victim_name: 4 children of Jehenne femme Nicolas Parisat
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost 4 children, either before baptism or while in house

harms_catalog.victim_name: Margueritte femme Colas des Mailles
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, hardly able to walk, still in pitiful state 18 months later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over fact that husband rang Ave Maria at hôpital

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Nicolas Moictrier
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly fell ill in childbed, lost speech, died in 5 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness persuaded her daughter not to marry, mother hated him since

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Jennon femme Colas Potier
harms_catalog.harm_description: newborn had to be baptized in house and died

harms_catalog.victim_name: Anne Moiron femme Bernard Huel
harms_catalog.harm_description: died in childbed after ominous prediction

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Claudette veuve Jean Mereille
harms_catalog.harm_description: found face down in cradle, died a few days after quarrel
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled after rescuing child from cradle

harms_catalog.victim_name: husband and two children of Claudette veuve Jean Mereille
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of husband and two children; one child burned in cradle with door locked

harms_catalog.victim_name: 7 children of Jennon femme Jean Grand Didier
harms_catalog.harm_description: 7 children dead - premature or stillborn births
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: claimed badly paid, threatened witness would never raise children
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touched her 6 weeks before term so child turned and she gave birth prematurely

harms_catalog.victim_name: Agnes femme Mre Didier Vaulthier
harms_catalog.harm_description: had miscarriage and later died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: would not help until Agnes pardoned her for previous disputes

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Alizon femme Nicolas Liebault
harms_catalog.harm_description: child died at age 15 weeks

harms_catalog.victim_name: Nicolas Jean Peltre
harms_catalog.harm_description: became as if out of his mind, then died suddenly after particular sheet put over him

harms_catalog.victim_name: baby of Fleurance femme Anthoine Sachot
harms_catalog.harm_description: baby died after 3 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: discontented because not treated as she wished

harms_catalog.victim_name: stillborn child of Nicolas Parisat
harms_catalog.harm_description: stillborn child

harms_catalog.victim_name: Barbon wife of Humbert Bastien
harms_catalog.harm_description: miscarried after accused touched her in church

harms_catalog.victim_name: Demenge (brother of witness 19)
harms_catalog.harm_description: paralyzed right arm (age 18)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: complained angrily he had not nailed up a chest

harms_catalog.victim_name: first wife of Didier Bandeça
harms_catalog.harm_description: died in childbirth

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Colas Salomon (mother of witness 24)
harms_catalog.harm_description: bedridden for 2 years, blind and paralysed

harms_catalog.victim_name: Anne femme Bernard Huel
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly became ill, as if demented, took 4 or 5 people to hold her; throat swollen; died next day despite doctors

harms_catalog.victim_name: baby of Barbon femme Mre Pierre Barbas
harms_catalog.harm_description: thigh became swollen after accused looked at baby; died 3 days later

she had killed her daughter Anthoinette

relationships.person1: Mongeatte femme honnble homme Nicolas Bernard

relationships.evidence_text: Barbon femme Mre Pierre Barbas, chirurgien
Nicolas des Mailles rang Ave Maria at hospital; wife of Colas des Mailles lived there

economic_context.details: Accused and husband had debt for pair of oxen they could not pay 25 years earlier, which led to her seduction by devil. Multiple witnesses mentioned underpayment or dissatisfaction with payment for midwifery services. Accused was described as 'fort difficile' to deal with and concerned about her status/credit in bourgeois households.

material_culture.context: Debt for oxen led to devil encounter
Given by devil - black to kill, grey to languish, white to heal
Demenge had not nailed up chest as accused asked
Particular sheet put over Nicolas Jean Peltre during illness
Accused complained not allowed to give Anne soup
Gave white powder on cheese to heal
Took part of host from Easter duty and gave to devil
Cut from child - claimed good for colic, needed five from firstborn daughters

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and accused's residence
Accused lived there previously before Raon
Where they lived 25 years earlier when devil seduction occurred
Where Nicolas des Mailles and his wife lived and rang Ave Maria
Where Barbon was touched and miscarried; where stillborn children taken
Attended numerous times, carried on neck of master
Home of Barbe, another midwife seen at sabbat

legal_context.redress_outcome: Did not seek reparation when called witch by curé's servant

hearsay_chains.content: During illness Agnes told witness she feared Jennon and thought she had made her ill
Heard Jennon's daughter say if doctors had not attended Bernard Huel's wife she would not have died
Heard her mother say several times she suspected Jennon was cause of her illness

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said she had heard Alizon suspect wife of Claudon St Remy (already executed) instead

third_parties.name: tante du curé
third_parties.context: Called accused witch multiple times; accused did not seek reparation

third_parties.name: daughter of Jennon femme Jean Petit
third_parties.context: Had been in service of Nicolas Moictrier; witness 14 heard her make statement about Bernard Huel's wife

third_parties.name: Henry
third_parties.context: Young man daughter was about to marry; Nicolas Moictrier persuaded her not to

third_parties.name: Sr Moiron
third_parties.context: Father of Anne Moiron femme Bernard Huel

third_parties.name: Damoiselle Elizabeth wife of Monsieur le receveur
third_parties.context: Lost 4 children allegedly killed by accused because she was chased during childbed and didn't know her status

third_parties.name: Colas Jean Peltre
third_parties.context: Killed because he supported his sister (tante of curé) in quarrels with accused

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial of midwife with extensive testimony (28 witnesses) focused on infant/maternal mortality. Voluntary confession followed by extensive confession under torture. Burned alive per Change de Nancy recommendation. Notable for high number of alleged child deaths and professional jealousy/payment disputes as motives.
